title: Helvetica Flair
content:
I was browsing forums from 2002,and found a discussion on attempted helvetica revivals. I was interested to find out how I could get my hands on these digital or hardcopy. Esp. interested in Helvetica Flair.

Thanks
author: Eric_West

comments.content: You actually want Helvetica Flair? I didn't know whether to laugh or cry when I first came across it. It's definitely a product of its time...

yea,

thought it would be an interesting piece of type history, might be good for some experimental ... experiments.

I interviewed the designer of Helvetica Flair, Phil Martin, last year on Typographica:

[http://typographica.org/2004/on-typography/interview-phil-martin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130426061303/http:/typographica.org/2004/on-typography/interview-phil-martin/ "http://typographica.org/2004/on-typography/interview-phil-martin/")

The subject did come up and Phil seemed a little nonplussed by my interest.
